FuncDef:
The ipv6 nd stale-timeout command sets the timeout period of the STALE state of ND entries.
The undo ipv6 nd stale-timeout command restores the default setting. The ipv6 nd stale-timeout command sets the timeout period of the STALE state of ND entries. The undo ipv6 nd stale-timeout command restores the default setting. By default, the timeout period of the STALE state of ND entries is 1200 seconds. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the timeout period of the STALE state of ND entries.
The value is an integer that ranges from 60 to 172800, in seconds.

ExtraInfo:
The STALE state of an ND entry indicates that whether the neighbor is reachable is unknown. Probing whether the neighbor is reachable is not performed unless there is a packet to be sent to this neighbor.
The timeout period of the STALE state of ND entries is a variable. If you want to quickly clear invalid ND entries, you can set the timeout period to a smaller value through the ipv6 nd stale-timeout command to speed up entry aging.
